alert.note: Alert for Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 4:57AM CDT until June 10 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Rogers, Tulsa and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 457 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Around 1 inch of rain has fallen across portions of the area with another inch or so possible before the heavy rains end. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Claremore... Owasso... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Inola... Sperry... Oologah... Foyil... Vera... Tulsa International Airport... Tiawah... Taiwah... Turley... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
